data.title: Hidden treasures to be found
data.text: Don't miss Main Street Grand Junction. In summer there is farmers market in Thursday. In winter holiday festivities. In between, lovely gift, clothing and shoe stores, restaurants and cafes. I look forward to it every time I visit.

data.title: Organized City
data.text: Spent the weekend in Grand Junction, very clean and many health food options.  Even visited the city library, was welcomed as I walked in and shown where various departments were located.  They had a Vets Parade on Saturday, a real treat!! As I am. VN VET!!  Salute the city care takers!!

data.title: Downtown is where it happens and The Rockslide is there.
data.text: Outside on the Main Street patio or inside the restaurant, appealing food and excellent beer can be enjoyed in a casual and comfortable atmosphere. The Rockslide is a favorite for locals and ideal for visitors to the area.

data.title: Very cute and cool downtown Main Street!
data.text: Loved this area during our weekend in Grand Junction, especially the sidewalk sculptures and outdoor patios. Will definitely come back to hang out!

data.title: Beautiful Main Street
data.text: We lived in Grand Junction many years ago and it has really grown and the downtown is nicer than ever.  The main street is still a serpentine but with much more art and landscaping.  It has very nice feel.  We stayed in a hotel on the street so it was easy to walk it several times during our visit.  We will definitely be back soon and stay in the same area.

data.title: An ideal place for a stopover on a road trip.
data.text:
We were travelling from Breckenridge to see the National Monument and Arches State Park. Grand Junction was ideally situated for two nights. 
We found everything we needed there, restaurants, shops, fuel stations, and a lovely pedestrianised down ton area to walk around and stretch our legs after sitting in the car so long. 
The town is very well cared for, lots of trees and flowers, sculptures everywhere, even the roundabouts are pretty!

data.title: Take a Stroll!
data.text: Strolled through downtown Grand Junction, just my wife and me!  What a nice time that was!  Plenty of interesting things to see.  Fountains.  Sculptures.  People.  Shops.  (I highly recommend Grand Valley Books!)  Food!  Perfect way to spend an evening!

data.title: Fun artistic walk
data.text: We had a fun time walking down Main Street enjoying the sculptures and other art. The atmosphere was inviting and the people were friendly. We didn't go into most of the shops because we had our dog with us, but window shopping and the couple of shops that we did go into (one person stayed outside with the dog) were also fun and interesting.

data.title: Clean and friendly
data.text: We really enjoyed Main Street, especially on Thursday evenings when they close the street for their farmers market. The stores we visited were friendly and helpful.

data.title: Friendly locals and lovely art
data.text:
We always assumed that grand junction was a stop, but on visiting the downtown it could happened to have been the final destination. Beautiful downtown with art on (literally) every street corner. 

Locals on a Friday night who were happily to chat away and pass the time. Lots of local restaurants and shops. What us brits have in our mind when we think 'Main Street USA'

data.title: Enjoyed an evening stroll.
data.text: We enjoyed walking a few blocks one way to eat then coming back to the car. The shops are all cute and if we had more time would have enjoyed shopping in more than a couple places. Loved the iron structures/statues all around too! Very Fun!

data.title: A great walking town
data.text: The main street is nice and wide,  lined with  artwork and trees. Its one of the most pleasant strolls I have had in any small town.  Lots of quirky shops, and good restaurants.

data.title: Beautiful Little Town
data.text: We had a great experience visiting the Main Street of Grand Junction. The town is very pedestrian friendly, with nice shops, eateries, and other amenities. But above all, the public sculptures are worth stopping to see. The only 'fly on the ointment ' driving here were the traffic circles. Don't let that stop you, though..just be vigilant!

data.title: Clean and Attractive Main Street
data.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in downtown and it was surprising how nice the Main Street area was. We could get everything we needed right there - even groceries and gas. The streets are attractively landscaped with public art and were very clean. It felt safe; although there were some noisy young people loitering about, we were not approached. This is a good area to stay at if you are planning to visit Colorado National Monument as it's very convenient.

data.title: some interesting points but not great
data.text: Downtown has a few nice features and historic properties. Shops were not particularly exciting and we were not that struck by the choice of restaurants.

data.title: Great Downtown! City with a vision...
data.text: We spent a lot of time downtown in our 3 day visit. Farmer's Market, Rotary Club meeting at the Avalon Theatre, Shopping at Enstrom Candies. Very nice. A great attraction to those thinking about moving to the Western Slopes.

data.title: fun
data.text: Fun place to go we went in September luckily it was warm and if you're with kids I give it a 5 out of 10

data.title: Wonderful, cute historic Main Street with life and vibe!
data.text: Downtown Grand Junction was an eye-opener.  It's sophisticated, eclectic, vibrant and spotlessly clean.  There is a great mixture of quaint shops, restaurants and bars.  Well worth a visit

data.title: Small but cute
data.text: Stroll down the street to discover antique shops, a brew pub, great gelato and ice cream and more. A fun way to spend an afternoon.

data.title: Quaint Downtown Area
data.text: This is a great place to people watch, walk your dog, shop for curios or grab something to eat with many restaurants offering sidewalk dining although most are not pet friendly (big miss in our opinion). On Thursday nights they close down Main Street to vehicle traffic and host a farmers market that's a must see.
